title: What is the best song by a well known artist that most people have never heard? - Quora

response.answer_text: Oh, my, yes. What is the best song by a well known artist that most people have never heard? I’ve been collecting albums and songs from artists I love since I was old enough to know who who was. It’s been a labor of love, gathering the tunes from here or there, buying soundtracks, collections, etc., just to get one track or other by this artist or that to round out my collection. So, starting with the first time I did such a thing, this is a list of tunes I think many haven’t heard, but the hardcore collectors among you have. They’re not in any real order, just as I thought of them. Enjoy… Elton John: “Michelle’s Song” (from Friends, 1971)  Phil Collins: “Which Way The Wind Blows” (from Anthony Phillips The Geese And The Ghost, 1977)  Sting: “Nuclear Waste” (from Fast Breeders & The Radio Actors, 1978)  Peter Gabriel: “Walk Through The Fire” (from Against All Odds Original Soundtrack, 1984)  Steve Winwood: “Crossing The Line” (from Go, 1976)  Sinead O’Connor: “Harbour” (from 18 by Moby, 2002)  Annie Haslam (of Renaissance): “Ripples” (from Supper’s Ready, 2006)  Mark Knopfler: “Atlantis” (from A Tribute To Hank Marvin & The Shadows, 1996)  David Gilmour, Bob Geldof & Chrissie Hynde: “Chicago” (from Keep Gary McKinnon Free, 2009)  Jon Anderson: “Don’t Make Me Blue” (from The Warriors, 1964)  Enjoy….

Thanks for the A2A! I'd say "The Hounds of Winter" by Sting. Really cool jazz-fusionish rock song with an epic drum track by the great Vinnie Colaiuta.   Other one I'd like to add is just about any song from The Who, since everyone knows the title theme songs from the CSI franchise; all of which use songs from The Who. Here's one classic rock tune from their legendary album Who's Next.
